intro: Sphaerocephalus multiflorus, commonly known as the globe-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are bell-shaped and come in shades of blue or violet, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sphaerocephalus multiflorus is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
